intro: Eriocaulon brachypus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and compact, spire-like inflorescences that bear tiny, spikelet-like flowers. Native to wetlands and marshy areas, it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. The plant has a short, rhizomatous stem and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
